 Cathy and I loved this book! We love Izzy, who was a fighter through all of the very rough events in her life. We love Axel, who still wants to protect Izzy, even though he too thought she had abandoned him years before. This book is filled with hot guys, rough talk and explicit sex. What's not to love? 
 "Never letting you go, Izzy. Never." He whispers into my hair, squeezing me a little tighter. 
 "I always have been yours, you know that, don't you?" 
 This is a super-hot, fast-paced read filled with Alpha males and a second-chance love story. There are also some great supporting characters in Axel and it looks like Greg Cage will be getting his own story. Sign us up, please!

BULLY is an instant classic! Tate and Jared's story pulled me in from the very first page, and I read this book straight through in one sitting. I could not wait to see how this story ended, and the author gave me everything I wanted and more. This book is a must-read. It has everything I need from a great stand-alone book: characters I care deeply about, a storyline that had me guessing from the beginning, very strong supporting characters and a conclusion that blew me away! There are even some steamy sex scenes which fit the story perfectly. I am so excited that Ms. Douglas has more books planned for some of the characters she introduced in BULLY, because I can't get enough of her writing! Read BULLY, you will not be disappointed

Fixed on You had been on my TBR list for quite some time and let me tell you, if you are in the same boat, MOVE THIS BOOK UP NOW! I absolutely devoured this story and am so excited to be able to read the next book as soon as possible, even though there really is no cliffhanger here. I just loved the story that much and want to read more about these characters. The plot is a little different from your normal gorgeous-millionaire-meets-beautiful-girl story: our heroine Alayna actually has serious stalker tendencies in her past so she has not allowed herself to become romantically attached to anyone. Hudson, our HOT Alpha also has some interesting secrets in his past, too. This book is pure reading pleasure: well-written characters, amazingly hot sex scenes, a connection between the main characters and a creative storyline. My heart ached for both Alayna and Hudson during certain parts of this book! The author has also created one of the most treacherous mothers out there as well as a great supporting cast of characters. I can't wait to see where Hudson and Alayna's story goes in the next book! 
 (Copy provided by the author in return for an honest review.

4 1/2 stars! HOT, fast-paced story in the Songs of Submission series. 
 I absolutely love picking up a book by an author who had previously been unknown to me. Beg was a total surprise and was a fast-paced, sexy read! The characters are all very well-developed and the Los Angeles settings are written with a lot of thought and description. I loved the characters of Monica and Jonathan, and the storyline is very engaging. I recommend this very sexy novella when you need a hot dose of a very charming alpha male and a smart, spirited heroine. My only complaint about BEG...it was too short! But the good news is that the author has written a whole series of novellas and I can't wait to read more of her writing.

4.5/5 stars! Great rocker romance. Full review to follow. 
 ARC supplied by New GalleyLickKylie Scott

Mid-Life Love is an entertaining story with very strong characters, and lots and lots of very steamy sex! I enjoyed reading a book where the main characters weren't 22 years old. Claire and Jonathan actually had substance to their characters, and I loved the younger-guy-older-woman story. This is the perfect book to lose yourself in, and just enjoy the story. I loved the San Francisco setting, and the secondary characters were well-thought-out also. I felt that Claire could have stopped doubting her relationship with Jonathan a little earlier on; I mean, here was a smart, successful businessman who clearly had real feelings for her and wasn't bothered at all by their age difference. Claire's continued insecurities were the only sticking point for me. The ending more than made up for that, and anyone who loves a HEA will love this book! I would have loved even a short prologue, though, but all in all, a great, escapist read with a neat and tidy conclusion.
***6 stars!!*** Full review to come. This is a must-read!!

I was totally hooked into Worth the Fight from the first page and absolutely fell in love with Nico Hunter! 
 We meet attorney Elle James who is a total workaholic and keeps her steady boyfriend pretty much at arms' length. Everything in her life is emotionless and neatly planned, just like she wants it. Elle doesn't want any drama or surprises in her life. Of course, all of this changes in a heartbeat when she meets MMA fighter Nico Hunter, and she knows her life will never be the same. 
 I've never seen a body like his so close before. It just doesn't seem real. Both of his arms are covered in tattoos, it looks like he's wearing colorful sleeves, only he has no shirt on. They intertwine and wrap around his bulging biceps and I get the urge to trace a path from the first splat of ink to the last with my tongue. My body's reaction to him is unlike anything I've ever felt before. These aren't feelings that I'm used to, they seem to come out of nowhere and are uncontrollable. 
 There are very painful reasons why Elle keeps her life relatively everything drama-free, and Nico, too, has had a traumatic event in his life which is revealed very early on in the book. Luckily for Elle, Nico knows what he wants and goes after it and wow! Nico is one HOT Alpha male, a really gorgeous, sexy and actually NICE guy who tries to break down the walls around Elle's heart and emotions. 
 I know I could have taken it further after that kiss. But I don't want one night with Elle. I want more. I have no idea why, but I do. A lot fucking more. 
 I absolutely love Nico! He took my breath away! He is tough, sensitive, strong and tender all at once. He loves his family and they form a tight bond around him. He has a loyal group of friends and trainers around him. Elle doesn't feel worthy of him or his attention and all of this builds to an amazing climax which will have you on the edge of your seat, crying and cheering at the same time. 
 Ms. Keeland has written a very adult story, with adult themes and problems, along with some of the most breathtaking love scenes I've ever read. Have a cold shower ready when you read Worth the Fight, you'll need it! I literally cannot wait for more stories in this series from Ms. Keeland.

We loved this latest installment in the Maddox Brothers' saga! Trent is hard-loving, hard-working, loyal and completely devoted to Cami. She is a good girl dealing with a bad family situation and trying to keep up with two jobs, school and TJ, her long-distance boyfriend who is does not seem to have much time for her because of his mysterious job in California. 
 What we loved best about this story is the devotion of Trenton to Cami. At first he comes off as a player but he is far from that and when he makes his true feelings known to Cami, he is totally swoon-y. He's uber-sexy, hot and protective. 
 "Because I've been in love with you since grade school, Chamomile. And everyone knew it. Everyone." 
 We also loved Cami, she is dealing with more than her share of stress between her seriously dysfunctional family, school, juggling two jobs and her mystery boyfriend TJ in California. We both really liked this book because of our devotion to the Maddox Brothers, BUT we did not like how Trent's longtime love for Cami was not described in more detail, maybe through a memory, or another scene or two. That led to a little bit of a disconnect between the two main characters. We are sworn to secrecy about giving away any spoilers but be aware there is a SHOCKER of an abrupt, surprise ending! Cathy figured it out from the beginning but I was clueless. And, the author just announced that the next installment will be BEAUTIFUL REDEMPTION, the oldest Maddox Brother's story. We will definitely read the next book because who doesn't absolutely love the Maddox Brothers??! 
 (*ARC provided by Atria in return for an honest review)

I don't usually read a lot of paranormal books so King Hall was a little something different for me! This is a magical, imaginative story that follows Lily, a young prodigy who is suddenly forced to become a leader along with three other friends. Lily is a "hybrid", which is very dangerous in the mystical world created by Scarlett Dawn. The action-packed story follows young Lily as she experiences loss, self-doubt and many epic challenges on her path to becoming the leader she is meant to be. 
 The author has created some great supporting characters in Ezra, Jack and Pearl. I especially enjoyed reading about the relationship and strong connection between Lily and Ezra, the sexy Vampire. There is lots of talk about sex and sexual tension in this book, but nothing too explicit. 
 King Hall ends with a cliffhanger, but it is the kind of ending that leaves you ready for the next installment in this story! This book was a very different read, and I recommend it for anyone interested in stories about magical, mystical worlds. 
 I received this book from NetGalley in exchange for an honest review.

Thank you to Mia Sheridan for the amazing opportunity to read an ARC of Leo's Chance! And to all of the readers who have experienced Leo, you must read this book. I was absolutely blown away by the writing, the characters, the story, and the very, very steamy sex!! This book had everything I love about a great book. Mia Sheridan is an absolutely amazing writer. This series is going on my list of favorite books. 
 Please read Leo, Book One in this series, before you read Leo's Chance. It is told from Evie's POV and you will be lost on some of the details and characters in this book without having read Leo. 
 I LOVE Leo! He is hiding a terrible trauma, desperate to get close to Evie, and trying to get closure on his very troubled past. 
 Leo and Evie both grew up in the foster system and he vowed to return for her when she turned 18. That became impossible and now 8 years later, he enters her life again: 
 "After only a couple days of following Evie, I was pretty damn sure that I was already even more in love with her than I was when I was 15 years old. Now I just had to figure out what the hell to do." 
 Nothing I write here will do justice to this incredible story of abuse, shame, betrayal and ultimately, honesty and the power of love. Leo's flashbacks to his time in the foster care system are gut-wrenching. I can't even imagine doing the research for this part of the story. My heart went out to these fictional characters and to all kids in the foster care system. 
 Leo's feelings for Evie are incredibly intense even though he is filled with doubt and self-loathing. But Leo's Chance is not just the story of two broken kids in the foster care system. It is an amazing love story, with some graphic and super-steamy sex scenes! "World's Greatest", indeed! 
 "This is the second most incredible kiss of my life. The first was with the same girl." 
 This book contained one of the best epilogues I have ever read. Leo's Chance is a must-read. I can't wait to read more from Mia Sheridan!Leo's ChanceMia Sheridan

4.5/5 stars! This was a totally surprising read by a wonderful author! 
 Mary Whitney is a fantastic writer and she gives us an absolutely beautiful story about first love. The story tells us what happened years before between Nicki and Adam. Nicki has never really gotten over Adam, even though they were very close while in high school. Adam helped Nicki cope with the sudden death of her sister and Nicki falls for him. 
 This book has a much more emotional feel than most stories about high schoolers. I felt that both Nicki and Adam were very mature for their age, which I appreciated. All in all, this is a wonderful story with very well-written characters. The author throws a few things in the way of Nicki and Adam finally being together, and the ending will really leave you wanting to read much more from Mary Whitney! 
 (ARC provided by publisher in exchange for an honest review)Beside Your HeartMary Whitney

When an author begins her book by recommending another book to read to get a feel for her topic matter, I AM HOOKED. I didn't think I could love a character as much as Horse, but I absolutely LOVE Ruger! Once again, the author has created a gut-wrenching story, super hot, tattooed bikers and some SMOKING HOT sex scenes. I was a little frustrated with Sophie in the beginning of the book, I mean, talk about bad choices, but I absolutely love her and Ruger together. And his tattoos...OMG. This is one uber-Alpha who knows what he wants and protects what's his. Joanna Wylde is an incredibly gifted writer and the second book in the Reapers MC series is a sexy, wild and beautiful story. Enjoy the ride!

"Bingo. Fuse lit." 
 Crashed is an absolutely breathtaking and stunning conclusion to the Driven Trilogy! I don't ever write long reviews but for some reason it has been very difficult for me to put into words the emotions that this book instilled in me. It has been a bag of mixed emotions saying goodbye to Colton and Rylee. 
 Spiderman. Batman. Superman. Ironman 
 I had a million theories about where this book would go after the absolutely heart-stopping ending of Fueled. It is a tribute to the author's incredible talent that all of my theories were wrong, and Colton and Rylee's story took me on an emotional journey that has stayed with me weeks after finishing this book. I felt every gut-wrenching scene, every emotional high and low and every triumph right down to my very soul. 
 There are some absolutely beautiful scenes in Crashed and there are some absolutely soul-punching, nail-biting ones, too. Each scene felt essential to the book, and I also loved how every character was fully explored in Crashed. I was on the edge of my seat throughout most of Crashed, but yet at the same time I didn't want to say goodbye to Colton and Rylee. This is a substantial, juicy story that is meant to be savored and enjoyed. And the Epilogue! Kristy Bromberg has earned a place in my heart previously reserved only for Kristen Ashley and Jodi Ellen Malpas with the fantastic Epilogue in Crashed. 
 "Remember, hurting is feeling and feeling is living and isn't it good to be alive?" 
 Colton's painful past is fully explored in Crashed and many questions are answered. Rylee continues to be one of the strongest heroines around and had me cheering and weeping throughout many parts of the book. The plot is very inventive and there are several relationships that I hope the author will explore in the future. Do not miss Crashed. It is absolute perfection, "A to motherfucking Z"!! 
 (ARC provided by the author in return for an honest review.)

"She's my motherf***ing checkered flag." Easily one of my favorite books this year. Disclaimer: I am no writer, so anything I say here will not be able to do justice to the amazing writing talent of K. Bromberg! So a few months ago a book called Driven landed in my in box along with a lovely email asking if Cathy and I would be interested in reading the book. Other obligations interfered until finally over the summer, I began reading what turned out to be one of my absolute favorite series ever! As a matter of fact, I started reading Driven (yes, I know this is the Fueled Blog Tour!) while I was on a family vacation that involved a lot of driving. Thankfully I have three other drivers in my family because every chance I got, I hopped in the back seat with my Kindle and said, "Oh, a two-hour drive? No problem! Let's go!" That's how obsessed I was with Colton and Rylee. I could not get enough of them. 
 I could not wait to dive into Fueled. And the author literally grabs your heart right from the very beginning and does. Not. Let. Go. My heart was pounding out of my chest for most of this book. And it's not just the amazingly steamy sex scenes between Colton and Rylee. It's the actions of Colton, it's Rylee's reactions, it's the secondary characters, the racing scenes, the emotional connection between Rylee and Colton. . . Well, you get the picture. 
 My blogging partner Cathy read Fueled after release day, and was very skeptical about my ranting and raving about Colton and Rylee. Well, she loved it MORE than Driven, and she is almost always disappointed with sequels! 
 Fueled has inspired a lot of fervor from readers and the author kindly responds to every comment, email and Tweet about Colton and Rylee. She is clearly as passionate about her characters as we are. We RACE you, Kristy! 
 So there's our little review. No detailed plot descriptions here because this book should most definitely be read without any spoilers, because the story is just, wow. Will you have a book hangover after reading Fueled? Oh, yeah. But please don't bother the author! She needs to write CRASHED ASAP!

"I bet he f**ks like he drives - a little reckless, pushing all the limits, and in it until the very last lap." Driven absolutely blew me away! Full review at 
 http://www.thebookbella.com/2013/07/1... 
 . DrivenK. Bromberg

4 1/2 emotion-filled stars for this beautifully written story! I absolutely loved this story about Cali, a girl whose life is "empty, closed off and bleak," even though outwardly she plays the part of the popular, carefree party girl. Cali devotes her time and energy to torturing Logan, planning one elaborate prank after another. Why does she hate Logan so much? The author keeps us guessing, only revealing that once upon a time, Logan was the best friend of Cali's brother, Ben. The story kept me turning the pages to find out why Logan allowed Cali to hate him so much, and what actually happened to Ben: 
 "Our rivalry is beautiful, because it makes us both forget about everything else." 
 It turns out that Cali and Logan actually have a lot more in common than Cali thought at first. They both love poetry, which plays a very important role in 'Two Roads.' As much as Cali's hateful behavior frustrated me at times, I absolutely loved Logan! He is a gorgeous nerd, who allows Cali to vent her emotions and hatred towards him, and just does not back down. 
 Logan sees the "real" Cali underneath her hateful and mean treatment of him, and tries to help her let go of her anger, and tries to shows her that her life can have meaning. He is funny, sensitive and caring. Although he plays along with Cali's constant pranks and her relentless hatred of him, he realizes what they have together. Will Cali ever recognize what is right in front of her? Will Logan let Cali push him away? 'Two Roads' answers all of these questions in a very emotionally satisfying conclusion. And trust me, Logan has now become of my favorite book boyfriends. 
 "Because you stole my heart, Cali," he whispers, running his hand along my cheeks. "You stole my heart and now you won't let me have yours." 
 Two Roads is a wonderfully-written, emotion-filled story that shows that no matter how hard you search, sometimes love is right in front of you. Well done, L.M. Augustine! Looking forward to many more books from this very talented writer. 
 Favorite quote: 
 "I guess I love 'The Road Not Taken' because it's saying that no matter what, you always get a choice in life."

Fantastic! Perfect example of why R.K.Lilley is one of my favorite authors. Character connection, great storyline and off-the-charts, need-a-cold-shower sex scenes. Bad ThingsR.K. Lilley 
 R.K. Lilley is one of my favorite writers and boy does she deliver an amazing story in Bad Things! I could not get enough of Danika and Tristan and I am anxiously awaiting more of their story. 
 There is no insta-love here. The author takes the time to build a deep friendship between Danika and Tristan but they do have an undeniable chemistry that they cannot ignore. Danika has a long list of strict rules for relationships and Tristan, well, let's just say that Tristan falls into the bad-boy category which Danika is trying to avoid. 
 Danika is totally honest and open with Tristan. He is who he is, and in his own way, is honest with Danika, too. If you have read the Up in the Air series (not necessary for this book but an amazing series), you know that Bad Things takes place several years before James Cavendish meets Bianca, and that Tristan gets clean and sober. You also know that something very tragic happens between Tristan and Danika. 
 There are several fantastic plot twists that I did not see coming in Bad Things. There are also several well-developed side characters with great stories. But Bad Things focuses on the EXPLOSIVE attraction and oh-so-steamy sex between Tristan and Danika and the author really knows how to deliver some heart-pounding sex scenes! Writers, take note: this is how you write contemporary romance! 
 "Oh, I like this one, I thought, watching his throat work as he swallowed. A sexy man who liked sarcastic women..." 
 - Danika 
 "You feel so good, sweetheart. I swear nothing's ever felt better in my whole fucking life." 
 - Tristan 
 I could not out this book down. I absolutely loved the characters and I want to know much more about Tristan and Danika's journey. Bad Things is must-read book by an amazing author. Enjoy the ride! 
 (Thanks to the author for an advance copy of Bad Things in exchange for an honest review)
Review coming soon!!

Rock My World is a very sexy entry in the Black Falcon series! 
 It is a fairly quick and very entertaining read. The story follows Aubrey and Zach (Riff's "real" name), as they return to Aubrey's home to meet with her father over a legal matter. Except that Aubrey hasn't told her parents she was bringing home her tattooed, rocker boyfriend! The awkward situation with Aubrey's very conservative parents only adds to Zach's insecurities, as he struggles to convince himself that he is good enough for Aubrey. 
 Much drama and hot sex then ensues in this very steamy novella. Will Zach and Aubrey let outside influences drive them apart? Will Aubrey cave in to her conservative parents and leave Zach? Everything comes to a very satisfying conclusion in this story. As usual, Michelle Valentine really delivers a catchy plot with very memorable characters and some scorching hot scenes. 
 I love Aubrey and Zach. Rock My World is a great entry in the Black Falcon series, and I'm looking forward to reading Trip's story next, in Rock the Beat! 
 Rock My WorldMichelle A. Valentine

4.5 stars!! I absolutely LOVE Emma Chase's writing style and Twisted is a delicious treat for fans of Drew and Kate! This book begins two years after Drew and Kate begin dating, and they are living together in New York City. Their chemistry is still HOT and sizzling, of course, because this is the Tangled series after all, but a very serious misunderstanding occurs which threatens the couple's Happily Ever After. What could be a simple event in the hands of another writer becomes an emotional roller coaster that kept me reading this book almost in one sitting. 
 There is tons of snappy dialogue and some very funny moments, mostly thanks to Kate's friend Delores. There are a lot of great twists and turns in this book and although I thought I would not be "hooked" on Kate's POV, I absolutely loved reading her POV. She is smart, witty, funny and sensitive. But I think my my favorite part of the whole book might be the Epilogue, which is written in my boyfriend's (oops, I mean) DREW's POV. The wonderful cast of supporting characters makes their appearances in Twisted, and I loved each and every one of them. Twisted is a funny, witty, intelligent and very sexy book and I cannot wait for Tamed!! 
 "He pulls the blanket up over both of us and holds me tight against him. And it makes me feel precious. He makes me feel that way. Always. Cherished. Adored." 
 "But to know perfection-to touch it, breathe it in every day-and then have it taken away? Loss is agony. And every inch of my skin aches with it." 
 "Even when I hated you, I loved you." - Drew 
 (ARC provided by the publisher in return for an honest review.)

Seriously, Skye Warren can pack more feeling and vivid description into a short story than some authors can in 350 pages. I immediately connected with the lovely young Erin and the object of her desire, Mr. Blake Morris. This wonderful, short erotic story is a total turn-on but is very touching at the same time. Read it, you will absolutely love this sweet and steamy story. Beauty Touched the BeastSkye Warren
Read this book. End of. Full review to follow shortly.This Man ConfessedJodi Ellen Malpas

Sexy, hot and absolutely exhilarating!! 
 It is kind of scary to read a book from an author who has given you one of your most beloved book boyfriends ever. Remington Tate is still my true love but Greyson King has stolen my heart. I loved everything about Rogue, the emotion, the story, the writing, and especially the very dark and beautiful Greyson "Zero" King. 
 I couldn't put Rogue down and found myself consumed by Greyson and Melanie's story. The book swept me along for a hot and delicious ride filled with emotion, happiness, and some trepidation. Would Melanie tame her guy? Would Greyson be able to keep his secrets from Melanie without destroying them both? 
 Melanie has been unlucky at love and falls hard for Greyson. 
 "He's a ten. I've never, ever been with a ten. And the way that he looks at me... I've seen that look before. The look that Remington Tate gives Brooke. That look. He's giving it to me and I'm dying inside. Can I die from one look? And if one look can kill me, then what would one touch do?" 
 So Melanie and Greyson have unbelievably hot chemistry but the tension comes from whether their relationship will survive once his true relationship with her is revealed. 
 Greyson is everything I love about a Katy Evans hero - he's possessive, protective, hot and very demanding. I absolutely loved the writing and the story as well as the dual POV. Rogue is a totally exhilarating, sexy ride from one of my very favorite authors and I can't wait to read more from Katy!! 
 "With you and me, there are no givens. No rules. Just what we want. And I want every inch of you. I want what you've given no one." 
 (*ARC provided by the publisher in return for an honest review.)

WOW!! What a ride!! Ripped was an unexpected gem from one of my favorite authors ever and I loved it from beginning to end! Pandora is a feisty, strong, take-no-prisoners heroine who came charging out of the gate at a hundred miles an hour. From the opening scene of Ripped when she and her best friend are planning a pay-back to Mackenna, to the very end, Pandora grabbed my heart and didn't let go. 
 Pandora has always felt crushed and alone after her first and only love broke her heart. And then went on to sing about it! Her life has become focused on getting revenge on the only man she has ever loved left her with not a look back. Mackenna was her true love, before he became a famous rock star, and to her horror, he wrote a hit song about her! She has spent years hating him. 
 When her prank goes wrong, to stay out of trouble, she must make a deal that involves her going on tour with the band. Will she be able to come to terms with what Mackenna did to her all those years ago? Will Mackenna be able to make her understand why he did what he did? 
 Sex, sex, and rock-n-roll. Mackenna is a sex god and Katy Evans doesn't let you forget it! Ripped actually has more humor in it than the other books in this series and I loved it!! And of course, lots and lots of heart in this one. 
 Ripped is classic Katy Evans, with a twist! The heroine is angry and heartbroken but tough as nails. The hero is sexy as hell, possessive and tenacious. I highlighted so much from this book that I'll just share my favorite quotes here: 
 "Stupid girl attracted to bad boy, V card handed over, heart broken, end of story. I'm not even worried about him." 
 "I'm familiar with Pandora and her mistake - letting all kinds of bad shit into the world when she opened the box. I've always been at war with my name. I'm angry at it because, right away, it makes me think I can never really be good. I'm a jinx." 
 "God, I'm such a bluffer. Black clothes, black nails? I'm a pussy. An innocent little kitty pretending to be Catwoman. This man could kill me, over and over, until my nine lives are done." 
 I absolutely adored Ripped and have now added Mackenna to my list of favorite book boyfriends! 
 (ARC provided by the publisher in return for an honest review)

Katy Evans has written an intensely sexy book which perfectly ends Brooke and Remy's roller coaster ride that began in Real. Katy's intimate portrayal of Remy's innermost thoughts and feelings is always fascinating, and at times heartbreaking, as the reader witnesses his constant struggle to love, be loved and simply live in the world. 
 Remy is not a standalone book by any means and I recommend you read Real and Mine first. Katy has created an unforgettable character in Remington Tate and her books have resonated with legions of fans, myself included. I absolutely loved reading Remy's POV and devoured this book almost in one sitting. Remy is almost painfully flawed as a human being but is also desperate find love and some kind of balance in his life. His struggles are, for me, the crux of this story. I loved him through all his highs and lows and hoped he would get his HEA! 
 You know you are getting loads of steamy sex if you have read Real and Mine. And Katy Evans really delivers on the hot and VERY primal sex scenes in Remy. Whew! It is Remy's POV, after all. Remy and Brooke's scenes together are totally hot. And very, very satisfying. 
 I absolutely loved the conclusion to Remy and Brooke's story, but I was a little sad to reach the end of this book! Like all of Katy's fervent fans, l feel very connected to Remy and Brooke and hope that we hear a little more from them in the next two books, Ripped and Raw. I give Remy 5 swoony stars!! 
 (ARC provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review)

"I love her, more than anyone should love anything. The kind of love that either fills you up or eats away at you. I love her at my own risk. I love her dangerously." 
 I call this book "The One Where Karina Halle Rips Your Heart Out and Stuffs It Down Your Throat." In AWMCTL, we feel every drop of Dex's anguish about his feelings for Perry. It is told from Dex's POV and because this is a spoiler-free review, let's just say that the author really knows how to wring every drop of honesty and truth from her characters. 
 "Shut the fuck up, man. Get over it. Shape up or ship out. Don't think I wasn't yelling those things in my head. But when the fuck did my head and heart get along anyway? They were mortal enemies now, sworn to rip each other to shreds." 
 But since this part of the EIT series after all, there is still plenty of action to go around. When Dex is abruptly summoned by Little Fifteen aka Ada to help Perry, he doesn't hesitate to jump right back into the fray to save Perry from mortal danger. 
 "You're my light in all this madness, Perry," I whispered, knowing she couldn't hear me. 
 Obviously, I can't wait to see where the author takes Dex and Perry in Come Alive (Book 7), to be released on June 23, 2013!And With Madness Comes the LightKarina Halle

Rare and Precious Things is a beautiful, lyrical book, taking the reader on a wonderful journey with two beloved characters, Ethan and Brynne, as they navigate the sometime-treacherous waters of newly-married couples. Raine Miller has written a fantastic, intriguing and SUPER hot conclusion to Ethan and Brynne's story. 
 Could there be a hotter book husband than Ethan Blackstone? I really don't think so! 
 "Ethan filled me up on a steady thrust, his hands at my hips for leverage. He made that breathy groan of pleasure that I loved to hear from him as he sank into me. "Feel that, my beauty. All of it--just for you." 
 As a newlywed and expectant mother, Brynne still feels a little insecure even though Ethan is clearly devoted to her. She is a plain-spoken woman, and not yet totally comfortable in the rarefied atmosphere of Ethan Blackstone's world. 
 "Good sex wasn't love. 
 For me, honest devotion and loyalty was love." 
 Ethan sees Brynne as his safe harbor, and his comfort from his inner turmoil and PTSD. The alternating POV's work perfectly here and kept me turning the pages late into the night. 
 Raine Miller writes THE most amazing sex scenes, without being cliche or overdone. Of course her characters have a deep connection after all they have been through together, but it is still vital that I feel emotionally connected, too, and I absolutely felt connected to Ethan and Brynne. Ethan is still battling his inner demons, and Brynne must still contend with characters from her painful past. Nothing in the story is rushed, nothing is as expected, and all is brought to an incredibly satisfying conclusion in Rare and Precious Things. A must read! 
 "Every day since the first day, you have made my life worth living. You make me wake up every single day knowing that I am a blessed man." 
 (ARC provided by the author in return for an honest review.)

4.5 stars!! E.K. Blair has written yet another extremely gripping and powerful story, covering the events surrounding Candace's trauma but told from Ryan's POV. I am a big fan of the male POV so this book was right up my alley even though it deals with some highly sensitive subjects. If you have read the first two books in the Fading series (which I highly recommend), then you know that these books tackle some very tough issues including rape and its aftermath. Falling is beautifully and emotionally written and even includes a healthy dose of romance and steamy scenes. Ryan's personality has been shaped by extreme violence in his past, and we get some insight into the initially cold-hearted SOB that he was before he met Candace. Parts of this book are very difficult to read but the main characters all grow and change and find some measure of peace by the conclusion of the story. The author has written a fabulous ending that did not disappoint. I loved this book and highly recommend the entire Fading series. 
 (ARC provided by the author in return for an honest review.)

4.5 stars! This is the perfect book to kick off your summer holiday reading! The Mourning After was more than we expected and really delivers a sexy, satisfying and entertaining story. 
 Georgia buys a beach house at the Carolina shore and plans to spend the summer renovating the house into a possible bed and breakfast. She leaves Washington D.C. and her longtime boyfriend, Kyle. 
 At the beach, she meets the very sexy Tristan and fights their attraction because of her relationship with Kyle. This might sound a little predictable, but it's not. Tristan makes her question whether she should sacrifice true love for the sake of others. Georgia, on the other hand, is loyal to Kyle, and believes love is not worth anything if you hurt others to be together. 
 "I want to be with you. I can't get you out of my head." 
 Of course, Tristan is super-hot and the story is full of MEGA-steamy scenes, plus plenty of emotion. Will Georgia stay with Kyle or will she follow her heart and let Tristan love her? 
 "I want you, all of you, Georgia. And I want you to want me too." 
 No spoilers but the title hints that a tragedy has occurred, and the events surrounding this incident are explained near the end of the story. This life-altering event also sheds light on Georgia's sometimes-aggravating actions during the story. 
 In keeping with a discussion I had with one of my favorite authors at Book Bash, I am keeping this review SHORT and TO THE POINT! Did we like this book? Yes! Do we recommend it? Yes! It is a great summer read, and will keep you turning the pages to the very end. 
 An ARC was provided by the author in exchange for an honest review. 
 The Mourning AfterAdriane Leigh

4.5/5 stars! 
 This book was a totally unexpected read! 
 As a fan of Tara Sivec's "Chocolate Lovers" series, I was completely surprised by the very emotional tone of WATCH OVER ME. The author takes you through every painful step of Addison's troubled journey in her attempts to recover from her mother's death as well as deal with her father's alcohol addiction. She must also bear the burden of managing her family's bakery business. She struggles through each day and barely holds things together. 
 Addison then meets the wonderful Zander, and it seems as if she is finally learning to work through her grief. He accepts her unconditionally, emotional problems and all. Addison is also receiving counseling, which seems to be helping her live a full and normal life. Then the author throws in a few major plot twists which will totally surprise you! 
 The story caught me completely off guard and I absolutely loved the direction the author took with this book. Do not read any reviews with spoilers; it's best if you read this book without knowing too much detail about the plot! 
 The cast of supporting characters is also very well-written, and their presence really added to the storyline. If you like a solidly emotional story, with a really surprising plot twist or two, then WATCH OVER ME is for you!Watch Over MeTara Sivec

What a surprise!! 5 FANTASTiC, COULDN'T-PUT-IT-DOWN STARS!! 
 I'll admit it. Even though I am addicted to reading, sometimes I get a little jaded...And then a book like Tangled comes along, and BAM! Just like that, I'm addicted to reading again. Seriously, a book that cites Braveheart, the Borg, an NYU sex study and frogs? I'm in. 
 Tangled is one of the most original books I have ever read. Told from the main male character Drew's POV, the very talented author gives the reader a peek into how guys really feel and think: 
 "Every healthy man in the world wakes up with a stiffy. A fatty. Morning wood. I'm sure there's some medical explanation for the phenomenon, but I just like to think of it as a little present from God." 
 Drew is insanely attractive, smart, hard-working and very wealthy. Sounds cliche, right? In the hands of this talented author, Drew is one of the most memorable and original characters I have ever encountered! I love Drew's inner monologues. They are both hysterically funny and very, very touching. He's a self-confessed womanizer who meets his match in the very smart and gorgeous Kate Brooks. He falls hard for Kate and all his old rules about women and dating fly out the window. 
 "Women fall in love quicker than men. Easier and more often. But when guys fall? We go down harder. And when things go bad? When it's not us who ends it? We don't get to walk away. 
 We crawl. " 
 The author has described the genre of Tangled as "Comedic Erotica" and "Funny Smut." Both phrases describe this book to a tee. It is both hilarious and very, very intense. I started reading this book past midnight and did not want to put it down. Seriously, it's that addictive. Don't waste time reading this review. Start reading Tangled. You will absolutely fall in love with Drew! 
 ARC provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review.TangledEmma Chase
Breathtaking!! Full review on May 28th.

Gorgeously-written, very sexy story! 
 Nina Lane continues to enchant and delight in the second book in the Spiral of Bliss series! What can be said to add to the many 5-star reviews for Allure, other than to say it is a must-read? The author has once again crafted a deeply erotic and romantic storyline that will keep you turning the pages well into the wee hours of the morning. 
 Allure picks up where Arouse left off. (Since there is a surprise at the end of Arouse, I absolutely recommend that you read Arouse first.) Once again, the author uses a dual POV that switches seamlessly between Olivia and Dean. And once again, Ms. Lane knocks it out of the park with the sex scenes! Just when you think you have read it all before, along comes a book like Allure to show you just how stunningly beautiful erotica can be. 
 Allure reveals more about the development of Dean and Liv's relationship, told in flashbacks woven into the current story. He was very careful with her in the beginning and always treated her as a treasure. 
 "Be with me, Liv," he said. "Just be with me." 
 Liv fell hard for the professor, despite the barriers she had erected to protect herself: 
 "I was crazy about him. I loved the way he invested everything with such purpose, the way he focused his attention on me and really listened when I talked." 
 "I move closer to him and tuck my face into the juncture of his shoulder. Breathe in the scent of his skin. Feel his heart beating against my palm." 
 Dean and Olivia must travel to California due to a family crisis, and it is there that many of the crucial events in the book unfold. We meet Dean's family and Helen, his former wife. The author does an amazing job of introducing all of these characters and filling in Dean's backstory. (No spoilers, but there is one character that I feel is very misunderstood and who I would LOVE to see get their own book!) 
 Dean and Liv are deeply connected and very much in love, but will their relationship be strong enough to withstand the several distressing events that occur in Allure? There is an absolutely incredible storyline that will leave you wanting much, much more. I am anxiously awaiting the continuation of Dean and Liv's story in Awaken. 
 Allure is a must-read, don't miss out! 
 AllureNina Lane

Wonderful story that tackles a very emotional subject with great sensitivity and grace. There is no "one size fits all" when it comes to recovering from a traumatic assault. Loved Ryan and can't wait for his story.
Sexy biker book with a twist (or two!) Review to follow.

WARNING FROM THE AUTHOR: Wanderlust is a dark erotic novel which explores dubious consent, captivity, and power play. Not intended for those uncomfortable with the subject matter or under eighteen. 
 Wanderlust is one of our top books of 2013! I am a big fan of dark erotica so the author's warning and the subject matter did not scare me away, and you shouldn't shy away from this story either! The author has crafted a heart-wrenching tale of pain, survival and love that will leave you wanting much more of Evie and Hunter's story. 
 Can love come from pain? This is the theme of Wanderlust. Our heroine Evie is running away from a painful past and searching for emotional and physical freedom while on a trek across the U.S. to see Niagra Falls. Hunter is a trucker and let's just say they have a fateful encounter while on the open road. Is Hunter a monster? I don't think so, and in fact, I LOVED his character. Will Evie find the freedom she is seeking? Read the story and you will find out. 
 Ms. Warren has created two richly-drawn characters that haunted me long after I finished their story. I was immediately drawn into Evie and Hunter's lives and I felt a deep connection with them from the beginning of the story. That connection is essential to me as a reader and that is why I feel so strongly about this story and the author. 
 No spoilers here. Suffice it to say the storyline is absolutely surprising and incredibly fulfilling. The sex scenes in this book are disturbing, graphic and very, very satisfying. Wanderlust was the first book I have read by Skye Warren and I look forward to reading many more of her stories.WanderlustSkye Warren

"I see him. 
 I feel him. 
 I want him." 
 Sensual, erotic, and filled with emotion and desire, Mine delivers a one-two punch that will leave you completely stunned and satisfied at the same time. Katy Evans has written Remy Tate as the ultimate passionate and raw Alpha male, with Brooke as his willing and devoted woman. I found Mine to be even more sensually-charged than Real, more sexual and more erotic. Remy is hot, he is hard, and he is filled with love and protectiveness for Brooke. This is an intense love story above all, and the burning sex between these two will have you needing a cold shower (or ice!) to cool down. Do I judge a book by its cover? Yes, I do, and I couldn't possibly have enjoyed reading the gorgeous paperback ARC any more than I did. Read isn't quite accurate, I "ripped" through the pages! Read Mine. And try not to melt into a puddle while you're reading it!

I enjoyed the latest book in the Cut & Run series. With that being said, there is an awful lot going on in this book, and the focus is not totally on Ty and Zane but is also shared by Nick and Kelly. 
 The story takes our group to Scotland for a wedding celebration. Much mystery occurs with lots of action. Of course my favorite parts of the book are the hot sexy times between Ty and Zane and the sometimes humorous banter between them. Abigail Roux writes some deliciously steamy scenes and I wanted more, more, more! All of the characters are well-developed and it seems like the focus might be on Nick and Kelly later. 
 If you like a lot of fast-paced action, a good mystery and some really, really hot Alpha guys, then you will love Ball & Chain. I absolutely love Abigail Roux's wriritng style and look forward to reading many more of her books. 
 (ARC provided by the publisher in return for an honest review.)

". . .it's hard to feel bad for her, because as much as she's hurting, she doesn't know pain. She doesn't know it like I know it. I keep pain alive. I keep it in business. I keep it thriving with as much as I experience it." 
 GAH!! My heart. I am in love with Miles Archer. Another fantastic story from Colleen Hoover. One of my favorites!

Ambrosia picks up where Metamorphosis left us -- with a sudden tragedy that leaves Scarlett reeling and unable to deal with the two men in her life, the sexy, handsome playboy Ash and the sexy, handsome musician Mason. Scarlett began her journey in Metamorphosis by starting her freshman year at Rice University. She meets Ash, with whom she falls in love but who pushes her away due to her innocence and sweetness. But they can't stay away from each other and try to remain friends. 
 Ash is HOT and actually a very loving man. But Mason also captures Scarlett's heart, and Ambrosia explores Scarlett's emotional and sexual awakening. Will she choose Ash or Mason? No spoilers here but I will say her behavior and choices were sometimes very aggravating! 
 Ambrosia is filled with lots of missed opportunities, a few misunderstandings, and oh yeah, LOTS of super-steamy sex scenes. 
 Erin Noelle writes a very captivating story in Ambrosia with lots of very memorable characters. This is a great book for those who enjoy a somewhat angsty story where the plot is not wrapped up with a tidy little bow. I am very much looking forward to the next installment in this series! 
 And I'm Team Ash, all the way! 
 (ARC provided by the author in exchange for an honest review)
Wonderful book! Full review to follow

ArouseNina Lane 
 4 1/2 blissful stars! Finally an erotic novel where the marriage IS the story, not just an epilogue 
 "One day I'm going to touch you in a thousand different ways and show you how to touch me," he said. And he did. 
 Struggling with a tormented past, undergraduate Olivia Winter once led a practical but isolated life. Then she met Professor Dean West, a brilliant scholar of medieval history who melted Liv's inhibitions and taught her the meaning of both love and erotic pleasure. But after three years of a blissful, lusty marriage, Liv and Dean now face a crisis that threatens everything they believe about each other. And when dark secrets and temptations rise to the surface, the fallout might break them apart forever. 
 Nina Lane gives us two very relatable characters in Olivia and Dean. Her writing is superb and the story kept me reading furiously until the end. And did I mention that I am in love with Professor Dean West? He is a totally hot alpha male, who is also an intelligent and very well-respected university professor. 
 "Liv," he said, his voice rough with tenderness, " you don't have to be afraid." 
 "Why not?" 
 "Because I'll slay monsters for you." 
 Arouse gives us a candid peek into the inner workings of a once-perfect marriage between two somewhat damaged people. Olivia had a troubled childhood which left her scarred in many ways. Dean is her first love, slightly older and very, very sexy. He literally sweeps her off her feet. Something comes between them and they both must struggle with their own emotions as they deal with how these events will affect their marriage and their very tight bond. 
 "I love him to my bones, but suddenly I'm wondering what I might have been without him." 
 I am not sure why the "married couple" theme has been mentioned as not being everyone's cup of tea. Olivia and Dean have an intense sexual relationship and Ms. Lane knows how to write erotic scenes that will knock your socks off! I also loved reading Dean's POV after the mid-point of the book, it was a refreshing switch and gave me a lot of insight into his behavior during the first part of the book. 
 "I'll be here, beauty. Waiting for you." 
 This was my first book by Nina Lane. I absolutely love her writing style. Arouse is a brilliantly-written look into the inner workings of a real relationship. I LOVE Olivia and Dean and can't wait to dive right into Allure!

REALKaty Evans 
 FIVE HOT AND EMOTIONAL STARS!! 
 Summary: 
 A fallen boxer. 
 A woman with a broken dream. 
 A competition... 
 He even makes me forget my name. One night was all it took, and I forgot everything and anything except the sexy fighter in the ring who sets my mind ablaze and my body on fire with wanting... 
 Remington Tate is the strongest, most confusing man I've ever met in my life. 
 He's the star of the dangerous underground fighting circuit, and I'm drawn to him as I've never been drawn to anything in my life. I forget who I am, what I want, with just one look from him. When he's near, I need to remind myself that I am strong-but he is stronger. And now it's my job to keep his body working like a perfect machine, his taut muscles primed and ready to break the bones of his next opponents . . . 
 But the one he's most threatening to, now, is me. 
 I want him. I want him without fear. Without reservations. 
 If only I knew for sure what it is that he wants from me? 
 Release Date - April 9 2013 
 Review: 
 "Remington Tate is everything I've never, ever done..." 
 Not sure why I decided to give this new author a try, but I am so glad I did! I immediately fell in love with both Brooke and Remy. Real is a great debut novel from Katy Evans. Remington "Riptide" Tate will steal your heart right from the beginning. He is a brute of a man, an athlete, competitor and superstar underground fighter with a huge following. He desperately wants Brooke Dumas to see him for the real person that he is, serious problems and all. Brooke has her own issues, but really knows and understands the thrill of sports competition. 
 "He wants to be my real, not my adventure." 
 Remy and Brooke's attraction is instant but its a slow burn leading up to the first time they get together: 
 "My panties are soaked, and my pulse has gone haywire. I've never 
 condoned violence. This isn't me, and I blink in stupefaction at the 
 sensations whipping through my system. Lust, pure white-hot lust, 
 flutters through my nerve endings." 
 I don't want to give away any spoilers so I will just say that this story has a great twist that hooked me in right from the beginning. I read this book quickly but at the same time did not want it to end. Loved the Epilogue and hope to see more of these characters from Ms. Evans. 
 "And I'd give up forever to touch you... 
 Cause I know that you feel me somehow... 
 You're the closest to heaven that I've ever been and I don't want to 
 go home right now. 
 I want you to know who I am." 
 Thank you, Ms. Evans, for introducing us to Remy. Can't wait for more. 
 ARC provided by author in exchange for an honest review

4 Fantastical Stars!! 
 "What makes a hero is the one that's left standing when the others are dead. Or the one that gave his life so the others could live. That's a fuckin' hero." 
 Midnight Soul is the conclusion of the Fantasyland series with Noctorno (Noc) Hawthorne and Franka Drakkar, who was truly evil in the previous books in this series. But in trademark Kristen Ashley style, Franka's true side is shown and all of her secrets are revealed. She has endured terrible abuse for years to protect her brother and his family which she has hidden from everyone around her. 
 Not and Franka begin a very slow-burn romance that at first begins as a friendship and partnership. Kristen Ashley expertly weaves fantasy, paranormal and reality with touches of comedy and as always, a beautiful and enduring romance. The scenes of Franka and others from her world being introduced to the modern world are funny and thought-provoking and always entertaining. 
 Noc sees the real Franka and his love transforms her. I always tell friends who don't usually read fantasy that Kristen Ashley's books are magical and engrossing and Midnight Soul is no exception. The journey that Franka takes is filled with forgiveness and redemption and yes, a swoony Alpha who will stop at nothing to protect Franka and her loved ones. 
 Midnight Soul is an imaginative and sexy conclusion to the Fantasyland series. It is filled with unforgettable characters and as always, a magnificent Epilogue! 
 "You don't have a midnight soul, Frannie. Your soul is so bright, I look too close, I'd be blinded." 
 (ARC provided by the author in return for an honest review.)
Nice and angsty! Sexy and very emotional story. Team Ash all the way. But I have a soft spot for Mason!
4 1/2 stars, a beautifully written book. Full review to follow.

4.5 stars!! I loved this book! Alice Clayton writes with the perfect mix of wit, tenderness and hot romance. Grace is sort of an Every Woman, navigating the shark-infested waters of Hollywood as she pursues her lifelong dream of acting. She is insecure, she is very funny and she is very passionate. Jack is also very witty and totally HOT and is very much in love with the much-older Grace. 
 The "dark forces" of stardom and fame start to pull Jack and Grace apart. Her star is on the rise, as he falls in with the wrong crowd and succumbs to the pressures of life in Hollywood. I could not put this book down, and absolutely loved Alice Clayton's writing, filled with wit, warmth and SUPER steamy sex scenes! This book is funny, well-written and fast-paced. I highly recommend this series. I loved the ending but I don't want to say goodbye to Jack and Grace! 
 (ARC provided by the publisher in return for an honest review.)

Come to Me Quietly is the first book I have read by A.L. Jackson and I absolutely loved it! The author has written an exquisite story of second chances and the healing power of love. The book switches back and forth between the present and the past and builds up a fantastic sense of foreboding that is sustained throughout the entire story. 
 Aly and Jared were inseparable as kids until a monumental event occurred that changed their lives forever. Jared has now reunited with Aly and her older brother Christopher but he is the classic tortured bad boy, full of pent-up anger and unresolved feelings. Aly cannot resist Jared and their scenes together are breathtaking. They share a history together, making their relationship all the more deeper and meaningful. 
 I loved how the pieces of this story were woven together, coming together perfectly at the end into a wonderful conclusion. Come to Me Quietly is a powerful, impeccably written story, filled with tremendous emotion, tenderness and love. A must-read!

A very sexy and emotional debut book from author Jessica Ingro! Sam's story drew me right in, she really loved her husband Aiden but felt very disconnected from him due to their lack of intimacy. The author does a great job describing the intense attraction between Sam and her old flame Jacob, and the sex scenes in this book are incredibly hot and steamy. Jacob is actually a very nice guy and there really are no bad people in this book, unless you judge Sam for her unfaithfulness to her husband. I did find some of her behavior towards the end of the book to be a little mean-spirited, but the author justifies Sam's actions in the end. All in all, this is a very gripping, very sexy and fairly fast-paced read, and I loved the twists at the end. A very creative way to conclude this story! Stay tuned! There will be more to come from these characters.

Breathtaking and ultimately beautiful. 
 This is NOT just a simple retelling of Hopeless! Colleen Hoover once again weaves an emotionally powerful, often painful and always beautiful story that you will not be able to put down. Seeing the events of Hopeless from Holder's point of view, the reader is given insight into the circumstances surrounding certain tragic events from Hopeless and also into Holder's actions in Hopeless. 
 This will be spoiler-free for those who have not yet read Hopeless and because this is being written prior to release day. If you think there is nothing new that can be written about Holder and Sky's story, you are wrong! Losing Hope is an incredibly sensitive (and very sexy!) book written by a masterful storyteller. Ms. Hoover has actually made me fall more in love with Holder than I already was! 
 They're so perfect," I say. "Like hearts. I could literally stare at your lips for days and never get bored." - Holder 
 You will be emotionally drained after reading Losing Hope but it feels oh so good. Make no mistake, this is a heart-wrenching story. But there are no extraneous characters in this story, and no weak plot points. Every character and every event is perfectly meaningful and necessary. 
 "My attention is constantly homed in on her like I'm a compass and she's my North." - Holder 
 You should definitely read Hopeless first because it is amazing story. With that being said, you will love Losing Hope if you are a fan of Hopeless because it is a passionate, fresh and lyrical story. Enjoy.

Ellie Watt is consumed with revenge. She plans an elaborate scheme to trick her way into the inner circle of Travis, the criminal she blames for her life of pain. She focuses her attention on Javier as part of her scheme, but she most certainly does not plan on falling in love. 
 Simple story, right? In the hands of Karina Halle, it becomes a rich story of lust, of love and loss, sin and redemption, and trust and betrayal. 
 Ellie thinks she is control of her emotions but she falls fast and hard for Javier, and who wouldn't? He is handsome, protective, and worships Ellie. He is also a member of a violent drug cartel. 
 "I want your heart, your soul and your body. I want the you that you're hiding deep inside. I must have her." - Javier 
 "I need you, my Angel. And I'll do anything and everything to keep you." - Javier 
 "He wasn't good and he wasn't bad. He was just Javier. And he was mine." - Ellie 
 Ms. Halle has created some very memorable characters that will get under your skin and into your heart. I dreaded the ending of the book and can't wait for Ellie's story to continue in Shooting Scars (The Artists Trilogy #2) (expected May 13, 2013). 
 On Every Street is a prequel to Sins & Needles, but is itself a stand-alone story. You do not need to read Sins & Needles first. (But read it, it is one of my favorite books!) 
 ARC provided by the author in exchange for an honest review. 
 On Every StreetKarina Halle
Review to follow.

4 1/2 HOT stars! Lana is a fairly short ( about 100 pages) and smoking hot novella based on characters from the Up In the Air series by R.K. Lilley. The author really delivers on the steamy sex scenes between Lana and Akira. I would love to read more of their story! Akira is one hot Alpha with a lot of heart and soul. Full review at 
 www.thebookbellas.com

4.5 stars!! 
 Step outside your comfort zone and take a trip to Sector Four with The Beyond series by Kit Rocha. I never imagined a dystopic series could be so gripping, erotic, gritty and thoroughly surprising as these books by Kit Rocha. Although the authors tried to create a standalone with Beyond Jealousy, and it definitely can be read on its own, you will miss the rich background stories on the other characters in this book and I recommend picking this series up from the beginning. 
 Ace, Rachel and Cruz are the heart of BEYOND JEALOUSY and we are treated to a SIZZLING menage between these three very different and stubborn characters. I have always said you don't know Alpha until you meet an O'Kane, and Cruz and Ace are no exceptions. This is a world of graphic sex, unbridled pleasure, strong women and free-flowing booze. 
 This is a surprisingly emotional story as we get to delve into the insecurities and passions forming this incredible threesome. Kit Rocha writes some of the most intense, erotic and steamy sex scenes I have ever read, and BEYOND JEALOUSY is no exception! Rachel, Cruz and Ace form one memorable menage that I will not soon forget! 
 "It wouldn't be a f****d-up triangle if they met in the middle. It would be straight-up f*****g." 
 These three really care about each other and that forms the heart of the story. I highly recommend BEYOND JEALOUSY as well as the entire BEYOND series. Dystopia doesn't sound half bad with the like of the O'Kane men (and women!) around. 
 (ARC provided by author in return for an honest review)
Review to follow! Love Bren and Six.

Profane, imaginative and sexy. .Beyond ShameKit Rocha 
 There is nothing more exciting for a reader than to pick up a new book by an unfamiliar author and be totally swept away. Beyond Shame might be the most sexually charged book I have ever read and I loved every minute. 
 Noelle's discovery that she can be totally free, sexually and otherwise, in Sector Four makes for some thrilling reading. Beyond Shame is like a Kristen Ashley story on crack. The men are hot, they are sexy and the sex scenes are like nothing I have ever read. Even getting inked turns into an erotic experience for Noelle. 
 Loved the dystopic storyline and that the female characters are free to make their own choices. Jasper and Noelle are unforgettable characters. 
 Favorite quotes: 
 "If it'll bother you when the men start fighting over her, you better get straight. Because that girl wants it, and when she gets around to admitting it, the boys are gonna give it to her." - Dallas 
 "She'd have to give up everything to belong to him - her secrets, her body, her shame. It might all be worth it if he could set her free." 
 "I'm going to show you what it means to be mine, with nothing held back." - Jasper 
 Give this book a try. You won't be sorry. 
 Beyond Control, Book #2, will be available March 19th, 2013. You can read the first chapter at www.kitrocha.com

If you like your writing fueled by a little testosterone, then Karina Halle's The Artist Trilogy series is for you. Before you read any further, you MUST first read Sins & Needles (Book #1) or the novella On Every Street before Shooting Scars. Both books provide a rich and detailed look into the minds and motivations of the three main characters, Ellie, Camden and Javier. 
 With that said, buckle up, because Shooting Scars is one hell of a ride. Shooting Scars plunges back into the action right where Sins & Needles ended. Ellie and Camden are thrown into an impossible situation which leaves Ellie back with Javier, the former love of her life. Does she hate him? Does she love him? All is revealed in painfully beautiful detail in Shooting Scars. 
 Ellie, Cam and Javier are all incredibly complicated characters. What I love about Karina Halle's writing is that there is no black and white, no good or evil, no angels or demons (in my opinion). Each character has their own complex motivations for their behavior, and Karina refreshingly lets the reader form their own opinions about the characters. I don't want to describe the plot in detail here because Shooting Scars is a very intricate tale that is best enjoyed fresh. 
 Shooting Scars is filled with lots of action, romance and twists and turns. Is it painful? Hell, yes. And that is why it is such an amazing story. My problem? I need Bold Tricks like, yesterday. 
 *A copy was provided by Grand Central Publishing for review* 
 Favorite Quotes: 
 "Unanswered questions can stay with you a long time, riding on your shoulders, wearing you down." 
 "Such an angry little angel. Your wings are certainly dirty. They're black." 
 "He made me feel safe. Whether I was in his arms or at his side or just in his presence. For the first time in my life, I had a protector - and I never knew I needed one until then." 
 "He was like a fragment from my dream, a faded portrait of masculinity, heart, and ink."

Kristen Ashley is my favorite author. Her books make my heart pound, get my pulse racing, make me cry, make me laugh and wrap me, always, in a cocoon of family, friendship and love. Could you ask anything more from a writer? And Wild And Free, the third installment in the Three Series, does all of that, and much, much more. 
 Wild and Free contains some of the rawest, animalistic, sensual and gorgeous love scenes I have ever read. Abel and Lilah, destined to be mates for life, need to be able to draw you in to their characters and their fated mating for this to be a believable story. And boy, do they ever! Just when I think Ms. Ashley could not possibly create a more Alpha male than she already has, she writes Abel, who is a hybrid and who mates like nobody's business!! 
 This book contains everything you could possibly hope for in a paranormal romance. There is incredible, heart-stopping action, hot sex, other-wordly beings, super-hot sex, wolves, vampires and heart-pounding sex! I absolutely loved Abel and his story broke my heart. Lilah is a kick-ass heroine, brave, uninhibited, sexual. loyal and loving. These two together just might save the world. 
 I could not put this book down and was literally swooning at every page. Even if you are not a big fan of paranormal romance, and I do not read a lot of them, Wild And Free is a MUST-READ. This book is truly Kristen Ashley at her finest. She is not afraid to pull the punches and make sacrifices when they work for the story. And for that, I love her. Be prepared to be wowed. Wild And Free has loads of unexpected twists and turns and it is a vital addition to your KA library!! 
 (*ARC provided by the author, with thanks, for an honest review.)

LOVED this book. Wished it was longer! 
 It is such a wonderful feeling to find an author who really knows how to WRITE. This is a beautiful love story about two lonely people looking for love and intimacy. The characters of "Sabian" and Jocelyn are well-developed, there is plot and tension, and there are totally thrilling and HOT sex scenes. This was a completely surprising and fantastic book for me. I could not put it down. My heart broke a little during this book because of the predicament of the two main characters. And because Sabian is a male prostitute, well, you can imagine how freaking steamy the sex scenes are! Don't have time to put my favorite quotes here, I have to go read more books by Lauren Gallagher and L.A. Witt! 
 READ this book!
4 1/2 stars, what an emotional roller coaster of a book! Not what I expected! Full review to follow.
4.5 stars, scorching hot sex scenes and great characters but the grammar took away from my enjoyment of the story.

I was thrilled when Sylvain Reynard announced that there would be a final book in the Gabriel's Inferno Series. I could not get enough of Gabriel and Julianne and re-read both Gabriel's Inferno and Gabriel's Rapture several times when they were first released. 
 Gabriel's Redemption, the third book in the series, is immensely satisfying and stunningly written. Even descriptions of simple acts such as eating or studying take on rich and layered meanings when written by Sylvain Reynard. And the love scenes between Gabriel and his beloved Julia took my breath away. 
 "In the months since their marriage, their desire had not abated, nor had the sweetness of their coupling. All speech melted into motion and touch and the bliss of physical love." 
 This story takes place shortly after their marriage and shows the struggles that Gabriel and Julia -- like most couples -- must go through while building a life together. Will Gabriel overcome the guilt he feels about his past? Will Julia be able to reconcile Gabriel's burning desire to start a family with her own educational ambitions? She, too, feels guilt and conflicting emotions over Gabriel's plans for their future together. 
 "Gabriel was a consuming fire. His passion, his desires, all seemed to overtake the desires of those around him. He'd told her once that she was the only woman who'd ever said no to him. He was probably correct." 
 Sylvain Reynard weaves in many Old Testament references which enrich the love story between Gabriel and Julia. Nicely balanced with the heavy themes of love, forgiveness and redemption are the funny comments by the Snarky Narrator, which lend an air of levity to the book. 
 The secondary characters that I love also make appearances in this book. Professor Picton is a strong influence on Julia and helps to guide her in making certain life-altering decisions including dealing with the evil Christa, who is still out to make trouble for the Emersons. We also see a glimpse into Paul Norris' life and the dangerous Simon and Natalie also make appearances. 
 Gabriel's devotion to Julia remains unwavering and I loved reading their scenes together. He still battles with feelings of inadequacy but Julia's goodness helps him overcome his deep-seated feelings of guilt and self-loathing. 
 "Almost six months into their marriage he loved her more than before, he envied the very air she breathed." 
 I also loved the way in which Julia grew as a person in this book, and became much stronger in her educational studies and in dealing with her professors and others who conspire against her. She also stands up to Gabriel, who is certainly a force to be reckoned with. Gabriel, too, grows as a person as he uncovers facts about his past that help him find closure to certain events in his life and bring him some measure of peace. 
 "I suppose we're all on our own spiritual journeys." 
 "Some of us are further along than others." 
 Sylvain Reynard did a spectacular job of concluding Julia and Gabriel's story in this book. Once again, Sylvain delivers a richly detailed and deeply-felt story that will stay with you long after you finish the last word. I was sobbing at the sheer beauty of this book and can't wait to read more from Sylvain Reynard. 
 (ARC provided by the publisher in exchange for an honest review.) 
 And here is my one and only Professor Gabriel O. Emerson:

Very intense, emotional read 
 Emma has escaped to the US from England to begin a new life at an American college after a very traumatic family incident. She and Scott and very drawn to each other and Emma tries to fight her intense attraction to him. Scott is a HOT musician but has a very sweet and loving side to him. This is not your typical YA book and contains some very emotional, angsty scenes and some very thrilling sex between Emma and Scott. Definitely a sequel coming based on the ending. I like the author's writing style but found myself yelling at Emma throughout the book due to her constant pulling away from Scott! Looking forward to more from this author. Rocked UnderCora Hawkes

LOVED LOVED LOVED this book!! 
 Cathy gives this book 4 Stars for story, 5 Stars for the sex scenes. I Ellen) give this book 5 STARS!!! 
 Elle Aycart, where have you been all my life? I couldn't put this book down. Ms. Aycart gives us very well-written characters in Tate and James. (And guess what, James has BROTHERS! More Bowen brothers, please!) James is sexy, gorgeous, tattooed, and everything that Tate thinks she needs to run away from. But wouldn't you know it, James is SEXY and LOVING and he waits patiently (sort of) for Tate to come to her senses. 
 Tate and James "meet cute" in a Florida retirement community and agree they will get together JUST for sex. But they fall hard for each other, and Tate runs scared. This book had elements of Kristen Ashley which I loved. Intense sexual attraction, HOT ALPHA MALE who wants to protect his woman, and a storyline that leaves Tate in danger. 
 This book is about two people with serious relationship issues and ultimately a story about heartbreak, healing and trust. 
 This book is VERY EXPLICIT and the sex scenes are TOTALLY HOT. James is intense, controlling and I loved every minute. 
 James 
 I highlighted so many passages in this book but here are some of my favorites: 
 "When he regained his senses, his throat felt raw, his mind foggy, and he wasn't sure if his legs would work again-ever. What the fuck had happened? Had she killed him?" - James 
 "He felt feverish, out of control, famished, like he'd been waiting for this for ages. There weren't going to be any fancy moves from him. Just stark-naked hunger." - James 
 "It amazed her how giving James was. He didn't seem afraid of anything; he was so sure of her it scared the living shit out of her." - Tate 
 A MUST-READ BOOK! 
 More than Meets the InkElle Aycart
Hot and steamy. Review to follow..

Beauty From PainGeorgia Cates 
 UNEXPECTED 5 STAR READ 
 Very few books draw me in like Up in the Air, All In, Gabriel's Inferno, Bared To You, etc., but this book did. After reading This Man earlier in January, it was hard to find characters and a storyline that would keep me up all night, but thanks to Georgia Cates, I now have Laurelyn and Jack. This story had me riveted from the first page when Jack proposes an unusual arrangement to Laurelyn upon her arrival for a 3 month summer visit to Australia. She accepts and they embark on a HOT relationship. I won't call it a romance because neither one agrees to that, at least at first. 
 I loved the Australian setting but I will admit I had to look up a few slang words. 
 Sanger- sandwich 
 Oldies - parents 
 Coldie - beer 
 Brekkie - breakfast 
 Favorite quotes: 
 "You treat me like I'm somebody instead of a nobody." 
 "I've been wanting to devour this mouth since the first time I saw you." 
 "Jack, you don't always know the true worth of a woman's love until it becomes a memory." 
 There is a cliffhanger ending, of course, but the author treats us to a delicious Prologue. The sex between Jack and Laurelyn is super HOT but I really felt a connection between the two, thanks to Ms. Cates' writing. More Jack please! And make it quick!

A beautiful, beautiful book about tragedy, life, love and forgiveness. Kacey has been through a terrible tragedy and flees with her little sister, Livie, to Miami to begin a new life. Kacey has sacrificed her own dreams of college to take care of her younger sister and put her through high school. They move into an apartment complex with a cast of characters including wonderful new friends and one gorgeous neighbor, Trent Emerson. 
 Kacey tries to numb her emotions and tries to push everyone away who cares about her. I absolutely loved how this story unfolded and I found myself really rooting for Kacey to overcome her past tragedy and let her emotions in! There is FANTASTIC chemistry between Kacey and Trent. I also loved the other characters, especially Kacey's little sister Livie. A wonderfully written book that does not disappoint.Ten Tiny BreathsK.A. Tucker

Sins & NeedlesKarina Halle 
 SYNOPSIS: 
 Ellie Watt is used to starting over. The daughter of a grifting team, Ellie spent her childhood being used as a pawn in her parents' latest scam. Now she's much older, wiser and ready to give her con artist life a rest. But returning to the dry desert town of Palm Valley, California means one more temptation than she bargained for - Camden McQueen. Once known as the high school weirdo, Camden is bigger and badder than the boy he used to be and a talented tattoo artist with his own thriving business. Ellie's counting on Camden still being in love with her but what she's not counting on is how easily unrequited love can turn into obsession over time. When Camden discovers Ellie's plan to con him, he makes her a deal she doesn't dare refuse, but her freedom comes with a price and it's one that takes both Ellie and Camden down a dangerous road. 
 I wish I could do justice to this book but I am not eloquent enough. This is a stunning story that will break your heart, thrill you and leave you wanting much, much more. 
 It is difficult to write a review of this book without giving away any of the major plot twists. Karina Halle is a very gifted storyteller with an incredibly sensitive voice. I stayed up very, very late to finish this book. I could not wait to see what path Ellie and Camden would take. And oh yeah, there is some very graphic and steamy sex. 
 It is very gratifying to find an author who can surprise and thrill with such a great story. 
 There is a very satisfying cliffhanger (you'll see what I mean!) and thankfully more books planned in this series. A prequel novella, On Every Street, is coming on March 12th, featuring the "torrid love story" of Ellie and Javier. Shooting Scars (TAT #2) is coming May 13th, 2013 
 Follow Ms. Halle on Twitter @metalblonde 
 www.experimentinterror.com 
 Facebook www.facebook.com/Karina-Halle

SYNOPSIS 
 Hanna Boudreaux has lived in the small town of Willow all her life. She's sweet, cute and quiet. 
 Hanna has a moment of epiphany when she realizes her crush for forever, Raiden Ulysses Miller, is not ever going to be hers. She sees her life as narrow and decides to do something about it. 
 Raiden Miller is the town's local hero. A former Marine with the medal to prove his hero status, he comes home, shrouded in mystery. It takes a while, but eventually Hanna catches his eye. 
 After all these years of Raid and Hanna living in the same town, the question is why? Is Raid interested in Hanna because she's sweet and cute? Or does Raid have something else going on? 
 OUR REVIEW 
 We have had a love affair with all things Kristen Ashley since we first read Knight last year. Yes, Knight was our first foray into Kit's world, and we have never looked back. We have read almost every single one of Ms. Ashley's books. Each of her series are highly recommended. Our blog is new so we have not posted all of our reviews yet but we can discuss each character at length, and yes, we have read every Rock Chick book. You can imagine our excitement when we were selected to receive an ARC of RAID. We could not believe it! 
 Who can resist a book that even had us highlighting the Author's Note? 
 "I have many heart's desires and one of them is the slim chance that my books will guide women to accepting themselves as they are, having confidence in their bodies, brains and beauty and letting all that poison go so they can enjoy their lives, including sexually. 
 ROCK ON, KRISTEN! 
 We would like to think that there is a litte bit of Ms. Ashley in the character of Hanna. She is sweet, she is cute, she is trusting, she has a cat, she hand-knits afghans for a living and she lives in a small town. She has been crushing on Raiden Miller since she was a young girl. When he returns to town a war hero, and he finally notices her, her whole world is turned upside down.
